PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. William Brown, 2717 Wylie Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 4, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe that Negro communities actually choose their leaders or do they accept the leadership, which 'the powers-that-be' select and 'hand' to them?" answer reads: "I think that they accept the leadership handed to them and it seems to be good. The leaders that we have seem to be well qualified and doing a good job."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William Brown wearing hat, moustache, and light colored overcoat, standing across the street from the Law and Finance Building, Fourth Avenue, Downtown
